messages.message:
:alarm: Heads-up that the `ci-tests.groovy` pipeline that runs on every commit of every PR is failing to update Github check status on success or failure.

If you find that your PR is stuck waiting for the PR Merge pipeline to complete, but clicking the details link yields a successful Jenkins run, hit me up here and I’ll bypass it and merge for you.

Looking into why this is happening, but for now this is the band-aid. :slightly_smiling_face:
Revert is merged, this should in theory be working again. Let me know if not!
heyy, this pr (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/44084) looks stuck, if I could get it merged
Retraction, didn’t seem to help after all - my apologies! Investigating further.
@Cody Boggs this pr (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/44069#) also looks stuck
<!subteam^S038TM462UX> is this worth starting up an escalation for this so that we surface progress on debugging this in a common channel?
@Heymian We can if you’d like. I’m not really sure where else to look for the failure point here, as indicated in https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C035SLYCJ9X/p1689870895963979

Hrm, so what does that mean? Are things resolved? The last message on that thread mentions moving back to gcp builders and I see we’ve already done that. So does that mean that this should already be rolledback? Are you still looking at this or have you found someone else to help out?

It’s been rolled back, but it didn’t help, it seems.

As I mentioned in that thread, I have no clue how / when / where / by which dark incantation the tasks from `ci-test.groovy` post success/failure status back to Github :confused:

So I’m mostly stumped

Started up incident channel: <#C05HMSUSC1M|>. Can you share how far you gotten in there and tag whoever you think should help take a look next? And also what changes were made (at least that you were aware of)
